question_stem: A rectangle has a length of \(2x + 5\) cm and a width of \(x - 3\) cm. The area of the rectangle must be greater than 20 cm\(^2\).

parts.solution_text:
The area of a rectangle is given by length multiplied by width.  In this case, the area is \((2x + 5)(x - 3)\) cm\(^2\). We are given that the area must be greater than 20 cm\(^2\), so we can set up the inequality:

\((2x + 5)(x - 3) > 20\)

Expanding the brackets gives:

\(2x^2 - 6x + 5x - 15 > 20\)

\(2x^2 - x - 15 > 20\)

Subtracting 20 from both sides gives:

\(2x^2 - x - 35 > 0\)
